sites.name: Palais de l'Isle
sites.description: The Palais de l'Isle is a 12th-century castle-like building situated on an island in the Thiou Canal. Originally a prison and courthouse, it's now a museum and one of Annecy's most iconic landmarks. The building offers stunning views of the canal and historic quarter.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring and summer offer the best weather for exploring the canals. The museum is climate-controlled year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online to avoid queues. Guided tours are available in multiple languages.

sites.name: Cathédrale Saint-Pierre d'Annecy
sites.description: This magnificent 16th-century cathedral is known for its impressive Baroque architecture and beautiful stained glass windows. The cathedral houses important religious artifacts and offers a peaceful retreat in the heart of the historic quarter.
sites.seasonal_notes: Visit during morning mass for a spiritual experience, or in the afternoon for quiet contemplation. The stained glass is most beautiful on sunny days.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful dress is expected. Guided tours available on request.

sites.name: Musée-Château d'Annecy
sites.description: Housed in the historic Château d'Annecy, this museum showcases the region's history, art, and culture. The castle itself offers spectacular views of Lake Annecy and the surrounding Alps, making it a must-visit destination.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded on weekdays. The castle views are spectacular year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online to avoid queues. Audio guides available in multiple languages.

sites.name: Lac d'Annecy
sites.description: Known as Europe's cleanest lake, Lac d'Annecy offers crystal-clear waters surrounded by the stunning French Alps. Visitors can enjoy swimming, boating, paddleboarding, and lakeside dining with breathtaking mountain views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Summer is perfect for water activities. Spring and autumn offer beautiful hiking around the lake. Winter provides stunning snow-capped mountain views.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for lake access. Book water sports equipment in advance during peak season.

sites.name: Vieille Ville (Old Town)
sites.description: Annecy's charming Old Town features narrow cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and the famous canals that have earned it the nickname 'Venice of the Alps.' The area is perfect for leisurely strolls and discovering hidden gems.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring brings blooming flowers, summer offers outdoor dining, autumn provides colorful foliage, and winter creates a magical atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided walking tours available.

sites.name: Jardins de l'Europe
sites.description: A beautiful lakeside park featuring walking paths, flower gardens, and stunning views of Lake Annecy and the Alps. The gardens are perfect for relaxation and offer some of the best photo opportunities in the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring brings beautiful blooms, summer offers lush greenery, and autumn provides colorful foliage. Winter offers stunning snow-capped mountain views.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for morning walks and photography.

sites.name: Pont des Amours
sites.description: The famous 'Bridge of Love' spans the Thiou Canal and offers romantic views of Lake Annecy and the Alps. According to legend, couples who kiss on this bridge will stay together forever.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons, especially during sunset. Spring and summer offer the most romantic atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit during golden hour for the best photos.

sites.name: Thiou Canal
sites.description: The picturesque Thiou Canal runs through the heart of Annecy's Old Town, lined with colorful buildings and charming cafes. Walking along the canal offers some of the most photogenic views of the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Spring brings blooming flowers along the canal, summer offers outdoor dining, and winter creates a magical atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Consider a guided walking tour to learn about the canal's history.

sites.name: Église Notre-Dame-de-Liesse
sites.description: A beautiful 19th-century church known for its impressive architecture and peaceful atmosphere. The church features interesting architectural details and stained glass windows.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Visit during mass for a spiritual experience.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful dress expected.

sites.name: Marché d'Annecy
sites.description: A vibrant covered market offering fresh local produce, Savoyard cheeses, meats, and regional specialties. The market is a great place to experience local culture and sample Alpine delicacies.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best on market days (Tuesday, Friday, Sunday). Arrive early for the freshest produce.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring cash for purchases.

sites.name: Parc de l'Impérial
sites.description: A peaceful urban park featuring walking paths, a small lake, and beautiful gardens. The park is perfect for relaxation and offers a quiet escape from the city center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in spring with blooming flowers. Summer offers shade under mature trees.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for picnics and leisurely walks.

sites.name: Musée de l'Animation
sites.description: A unique museum dedicated to animation and cinema, featuring exhibits on the history of animation and interactive displays. The museum is engaging for visitors of all ages.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded on weekdays. Special exhibitions change regularly.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online. Guided tours available for groups.

sites.name: Île des Cygnes
sites.description: A beautiful island in Lake Annecy, accessible by footbridge, offering walking trails, picnic areas, and stunning views of the lake and mountains. Perfect for nature lovers and outdoor activities.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring and summer are ideal for outdoor activities. Autumn offers beautiful foliage colors.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

sites.name: Rue Royale
sites.description: A charming pedestrian street lined with boutiques, cafes, and historic buildings. This street is perfect for shopping, dining, and experiencing the local atmosphere of Annecy.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bustling year-round, especially during shopping hours. Beautiful architecture in all seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for leisurely strolls and window shopping.

sites.name: Cave de la Côte
sites.description: A historic wine cellar offering tastings of local Savoy wines. Learn about the region's winemaking traditions and sample some of the finest wines from the French Alps.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Wine tastings are available daily.
sites.booking_tips: Book tastings in advance. Guided tours available for groups.

sites.name: Parc de la Ravoire
sites.description: A large urban park featuring sports facilities, walking trails, and open spaces. The park is popular with locals for recreation and offers a great place to relax and enjoy nature.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring brings blooming flowers and summer offers shade under trees.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for picnics and outdoor activities.

sites.name: Musée de la Résistance
sites.description: A museum dedicated to the history of the French Resistance during World War II. Learn about the region's role in the resistance movement and see historical artifacts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Guided tours available on weekends.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online. Guided tours recommended for the full experience.

sites.name: Place du Palais de Justice
sites.description: A charming square in the Old Town, surrounded by historic buildings and the Palais de l'Isle. This vibrant plaza is perfect for people-watching and enjoying the local atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Bustling year-round, especially during festivals and markets. Beautiful in all seasons.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Many cafes and restaurants surround the square.

sites.name: Jardin des Cimes
sites.description: A beautiful formal garden featuring geometric patterns, fountains, and seasonal flower displays. The garden offers a peaceful retreat and is perfect for photography.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring brings tulips and daffodils. Summer offers roses and annual flowers.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for morning walks and photography.

sites.name: Musée des Sciences Naturelles
sites.description: A natural history museum featuring exhibits on geology, paleontology, and local Alpine wildlife. Interactive displays make it engaging for visitors of all ages.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded on weekdays. Special exhibitions change regularly.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Guided tours available for groups.

sites.name: Parc de la Mandallaz
sites.description: A large natural park featuring walking trails, picnic areas, and beautiful views of Lake Annecy and the Alps. The park is perfect for outdoor activities and nature observation.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring brings wildflowers and summer offers shade under trees.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

sites.name: Église Saint-François
sites.description: A historic church known for its beautiful architecture and peaceful atmosphere. The church features interesting architectural details and stained glass.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful year-round. Visit during mass for a spiritual experience.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Respectful dress expected.

sites.name: Marché de la Place du Palais
sites.description: A vibrant market held in the main square offering local produce, crafts, and regional specialties. The market is a great place to experience local culture and buy souvenirs.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best on market days (Tuesday, Friday, Sunday). Arrive early for the best selection.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring cash for purchases.

sites.name: Parc de la Foire
sites.description: A large park featuring sports facilities, walking trails, and open spaces. The park is popular with locals for recreation and hosts various events throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring brings blooming flowers and summer offers shade.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for outdoor activities and relaxation.

sites.name: Musée de la Marine
sites.description: A maritime museum showcasing the history of navigation and water transport on Lake Annecy. The museum features model boats and historical artifacts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round. Less crowded on weekdays.
sites.booking_tips: Book tickets online. Guided tours available for groups.

sites.name: Parc de la Garenne
sites.description: A large urban park featuring sports facilities, walking trails, and open spaces. The park is popular with locals for recreation and offers a great place to relax and enjoy nature.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful in all seasons. Spring brings blooming flowers and summer offers shade under trees.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for picnics and outdoor activities.
